alert.note: Alert for Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 20 at 6:04AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...The following areas, central inner channels, eastern gulf coast and norther inner channels. This includes the cities of Gustavus, Hoonah, Sitka, Port Alexander, Angoon, And Juneau. * WHEN...From late tonight through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, other low-lying areas and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage areas along with extensive street flooding is possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rainfall totals of 4 to 6 inches are possible along with freezing levels rising to 2500 to 3500 feet. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and reach critical levels.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Persons living along streams should stay alert and be prepared to take action if a warning or advisory is issued, or flooding is observed.
